Posts.Content: Hi I Janeen taking Letrozole, Cipla, and have horrendous back pain. Is there anyone out there who can advise if this normal(whatever normal is) and which brands are better tolerated? Thanks CCx
Posts.Title: supply of letrozole

Posts.Content: Hello there I managed to avoid a PICC line and am glad I did. You need to go with your instincts once you have been given the information.  Good luck on Thursday, once you have got this over and done with you will know what to expect. You can do this.  CCx
Posts.Title: Cannula vs PICC vs Port??

Posts.Content: I wore caps and headscarves until I had a bit of hair. It really is personal preference and I chose not to show my bald head outside home. Also it is quite cold without hair! I did have my hair cut really short before it started to fall out and that was a big help. No hassle and I had an idea what I might look like when it grows out. I now have very curly short hair and everyone loves it. I am still trying to get used to it along with all the other changes!!  Take care everyone.  CCx
Posts.Title: No headscarf

Posts.Content: Your response is perfectly normal trust me. It is a terrifying time and you will need to find someone you can talk to. Apart from us lot!!! You have to take every day as it comes and start creating memories with your beautiful daughters. It is very difficult but try to find ways to distract yourself with the girls and be proud of all you achieve at the end of every day.  Love and hugs  CCxxxx
Posts.Title: Waiting on scan for lump in left breast, worried sick.

Posts.Content: Brilliant thank you and good luck with your teeth! Remember we are all here for each otherxxx
Posts.Title: Uplifting things

Posts.Content: Belated welcome to our club. I agree the minute you are diagnosed every ache and pain is sinister. That does improve with time and we still have to be vigilant so it can be tricky. Always ask if you are worried that is what the medical team is there for.  CCx
Posts.Title: Hi newly diagnosed and scared it's already sprea

Posts.Content: Hi Phaedra I had my dose reduced and am confident that it still worked. There is point at all in them giving us ineffective therapy!!!! It is frightening and we have to trust the team CCx
Posts.Title: Reduced dose of chemo

Posts.Content: Hi there, I finished radiotherapy in March and in the last few days my breast is swollen and my shoulder and neck ache. Has anyone else experienced this if so what did they do? It could be the Letrozole but any advice will be welcome.  Thank you  CCx
Posts.Title: Radiotherapy and breast swelling and pain.

Posts.Content: Thank you I am lucky enough to be in France and it is intermittent so will see how it goes and see my GP when I get home. Take care CCx
Posts.Title: Radiotherapy and breast swelling and pain.

Posts.Content: I finished my treatment at the end of December and am still experiencing tooth pain and my nails are a complete mess. I wondered if anyone out there has any advice?
Posts.Title: Taxotere and tooth pain

Posts.Content: Sorry just read this and thanks.  Kty
Posts.Title: Taxotere and tooth pain
